meanings.definition: To settle or pay off (a debt)
meanings.sent1: I need to liquidate my credit card bill before the due date.
meanings.sent2: She liquidated her loan by making monthly payments.
meanings.sent3: Trying to liquidate my debt with Monopoly money didn't work.
meanings.sent4: He managed to liquidate his debt mountain by working extra hours.
meanings.sent5: Liquidating the debt felt like lifting a heavy burden off my shoulders.

meanings.sent1: The company decided to liquidate its stocks to raise funds.
meanings.sent2: They had to liquidate their savings to cover the unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent3: I tried to liquidate my toys into cash, but no one wanted them.
meanings.sent4: She had to liquidate her jewelry collection to pay for the repairs.
meanings.sent5: Liquidating assets quickly became the only option to get the needed cash.

meanings.definition: To eliminate or get rid of (something)
meanings.sent1: The company had to liquidate excess inventory to make space for new products.
meanings.sent2: She decided to liquidate her old furniture to create a minimalist living space.
meanings.sent3: I attempted to liquidate the pile of laundry by throwing it out the window, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: He had to liquidate his collection of comic books to declutter his room.
meanings.sent5: Liquidating unnecessary items made the room feel more spacious and organized.
